docs.title: Download
docs.text:
To download the latest version of Eddy3D, please fill out the following information form. Any information you provide here will only be used by the Eddy3D team and will not be shared with any other individuals or organizations.

Upon completing the form, you will receive an email with the download link for Eddy3D. Depending on the desired use case, you must install additional software (BlueCFD, Radiance), see here.

Please make sure to manually type in your information, do not use autofill as the text might not be submitted correctly.

Your subscription could not be saved. Please try again. Your subscription has been successful. Please check your inbox for the download link. Please also check your spam folder it the email does not arrive within the next 2 minutes. Enter your first name Enter your last name Enter your E-Mail Enter your job title Enter your institution Enter your current profession Download Eddy3D

docs.title: Latest Versions
docs.text:
Beta branch:

0.4.15.1 (Jan 28, 2025) — works with Rhino 8.15 (does not work with Rhino 7 anymore due to incompatibility issues introduced by McNeel) SHA256: 60DB2DE850CB2A8940877ED60E1EA471CDB0008C69ED8CEE746E9FE43B3ABF1C

Main branch: 0.3.8.0 (Feb 17, 2021) — works with Rhino 6

docs.title: Known Issues
docs.text:
Beta branch:

Eddy3D-Dev · Discussions · GitHub

Main branch:

  • Probing on decomposed cases doesn’t work for now (need to reconstruct first).
  • The latest release of Eddy3D (v0.3.8.0) currently only works with Rhino 6. McNeel made changes to the SDK in Rhino 7 which renders the box-shaped simulation domain incompatible with v0.3.8.0. Fixed on beta branch.

docs.title: 0.4.15.0 (Jan 21, 2025)
docs.text:
• Fixed: In Rhino 8.9 McNeel introduced a breaking change, see here. Please do not update to Rhino 8.9! If you upgraded to Rhino 8.9 already, below are links to downgrade to various versions Rhino 8.8:
  • https://files.mcneel.com/dujour/exe/20240618/rhino_en-us_8.8.24170.13001.exe
  • https://files.mcneel.com/dujour/exe/20240611/rhino_en-us_8.8.24163.12481.exe

docs.title: 0.4.8.0 (Mar 4, 2024)
docs.text: • Fixed: Wind Factor Component version 4.2 is throwing error in Annual wind study template

docs.title: 0.4.2.1 (Jan 21, 2024)
docs.text: • Recompiled for Rhino 7, due to Rhino 8 introducing breaking changes in the UI, see below.

docs.title: 0.4.2.0 (Dec 23, 2023)
docs.text:
• Added: custom boundary conditions per individual wind direction.
  • Added alpha/experimental Rhino 8 compatibility. R8 introduces breaking changes, see here.

docs.title: 0.4.1.4 (Nov 23, 2023)
docs.text: • Fixed issue with “covid19” function object for the indoor module.

docs.title: 0.4.1.1 (Apr 29, 2022)
docs.text: • New installer to fix BlueCFD 2017 issue with Indoor module.

docs.title: 0.4.1.0 (Apr 17, 2022)
docs.text:
• Updated both outdoor and indoor module to BlueCFD 2020.
  • Updated MRT calculation, still experimental.

docs.title: 0.4.0.10 (Apr 6, 2022)
docs.text:
• Update to BlueCFD 2020.
  • Indoor Module
  • Updated MRT calculation.
  • Improved numerical robustness by Tobias Holzmann.

docs.title: 0.3.8.0 (Feb 17, 2021)
docs.text:
• Age of air in simulation domain can be evaluated.
  • Simulation of trees modeled as porous media is supported.
  • MRT component was updated with the TwoPhase method, see this publication.
  • General stability has been improved.
  • Culling of probing points outside of domain is now robust.

• Fix for problem with cp probing.
  • Added switch for potentialFoam initialization and mesh renumbering.
  • Added Lawson, Davenport, and NEN8100 pedestrian comfort indices.

• Fix for change in latest Rhino release.
  • Probing component automatically refreshes after probing has finished.

• Added: cellPoint interpolation instead of cellPointFace
  • Fix: WindFactors, MRT, UTCI running
  • Fix: Many bug fixes
  • Added: Paraview/Residual component now select from executable of choice
  • Added: Template engine implemented
• Fix: turbulentEpsilon was 0 if the ABL BC was in use

• Fix: Both Box and Cylinder are converging properly when terrain is in use
  • Fix: Alwas load the residuals for the first wind direction instead of wind direction “0” if the selection is empty
  • Fix: locationInMesh works with Terrain for BoxDomain
  • Change: fvSchemes according to SimScale
  • Change: New mesh settings
  • Change: Slip BC for all symmetry patches instead of symmetry
  • Fix: Domain has correct size if TerrainMesh is being used
  • Fix: Perim .stls were written in snappyHexMeshDict if TerrainMesh was connected
  • Added: Option to adapt dimensions of box domains
  • Fix: Erroneous case decomposition with BlueCFD
  • Change: Renamed output of settings components
  • Added: div(U) batch files

• New component: ParaView can now be opened from the canvas
  • Fixes:
  • The ParaView are now called as their respective wind directions which helps to distinguish them if more than one if opened in ParaView

docs.title: Support
docs.text:
We are currently collecting bugs and requests for new features on Github. where people help each other out with questions that go beyond our Getting Started information. Please feel free to start a new thread if you have any questions.

If your problem is urgent, please also notify us via e-mail as we are unable to monitoring new posts 24/7.

Hi,

This is my question. — OS: Windows 10 Pro Eddy3D Version: 0.3.8.0 Rhino Version: 6.43.3324

How to increase to probability of receiving fast and helpful answers.

Please include the following in your post

  1. A clear question or intent
  2. Clear description of your problem, ideally with a screenshot.
  3. What have you done so far to solve it?
  4. Please add a minimal Grasshopper file (.gh or .ghx) that contains only component relevant to your problem with all data internalized
  5. Please add the following: Eddy3D Version, Rhino Version, Windows 10 Version

docs.title: A Grasshopper plugin for microclimate simulations
Overview
docs.text: UMCF (urbanMicroclimateFoam) is an open-source solver for coupled physical processes modeling urban microclimate based on OpenFOAM.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
CFD - Computational fluid dynamics model - Solves turbulent, convective airflow - Handles heat and moisture transport in the air subdomain

HAM - Heat moisture transport model - Manages absorption and transport - Controls storage of heat and moisture in porous building materials

RAD - Radiation model - Calculates net longwave and shortwave radiative heat fluxes - Uses view factor approach

VEG - Vegetation model - Solves heat balance for urban trees - Handles green surfaces

docs.title: Step-by-Step Guide
docs.text:
1. Install blueCFD-Core
  2. Download blueCFD-Core-2020-1-win64-setup.exe from bluecfd.github.io

  3. This provides OpenFOAM 8

  4. Install UMCF Plugin

  5. In Rhinoceros, execute PackageManager command
  6. Search for UMCF and click Install (View on RhinoPackages)
  7. Optional: Check Include pre-releases for all versions
  8. Restart Rhinoceros to complete installation

  1. Verify Installation
  2. Navigate to UMCF tab in Grasshopper ribbon
  3. Find Check Installation under Meta subcategory
  4. Set Check input to True
  5. This verifies integrity of blueCDF-Core 2020 and urbanMicroclimateFoam files

docs.title: 1. Simulation Domain Configuration
docs.text: The simulation domain consists of three regions: 1. air region 2. solid region 3. vegetation region

docs.title: 2. Air Region Setup
docs.text: Managed by UMCF.AirRegion class - Determined by Box Domain Dimensions - Includes Atmospheric Boundary Layer (ABL) condition: - Wind Speed - Height - Wind Direction

docs.title: 3. Solid Region Setup
docs.text: Managed by UMCF.SolidRegion class - Requires mesh geometry input - Stores: - region name - material - Optional thickness value - mesh parameters - building temperature

docs.title: 4. Vegetation Region Configuration
docs.text: Managed by UMCF.VegetationRegion - Requirements: -meshgeometry input -Leaf Area Density(LAD) -vegetation properties-mesh parameters

docs.title: 5. Timing Parameters
docs.text: Uses EnergyPlus Weather file (.EPW) - Requires: - start day (365-day based) - start time -duration - end time is calculated by adding the start time and duration

docs.title: 6. Simulation Settings
docs.text: Key parameters include: - Number of CPUs (N) - maxFluidIterations (F) - Write Interval (W) - Initial Solid Timestep Factor (I) - minDeltaT (T) - maxDeltaT (T) - minFluidIteration (F) - pcEqnForm (p) - dampingThickness (d) - alphaCoefU (U) - alphaCoefT (T)

docs.title: 7. Case Generation
docs.text:
• Connect all configured components
  • Set Write Case to True
  • Outputs UMCF.UMCFCase which must be connected to the Case Run component

docs.title: 8. Simulation Execution
docs.text:
• Two-step process:
    1. Prepare simulation: Set Prepare Simulation or Prepare Simulation in Parallel to True
    1. Run Simulation: Set Run Simulation or Run Simulation in Parallel to True

Note: Use consistent parallel settings for preparation and execution

docs.title: 9. Analysis & Visualization
docs.text:
• Uses probing component
  • Samples field values at point locations
  • Writes results to file using input fields
  • Enables value analysis and visualization by running the probes function

docs.title: Team
docs.text: Name Seniority Major Department GitHub Marcelo Alvarez Masters Architecture (DC) ARCH @alvarezdmarch Gonzalo Vegas PhD Architecture ARCH @gvegaso Shruti Jadhav Masters Architecture (HBP) ARCH @ShrutiJadhav27 Rui Shen Masters Architecture (DC) ARCH @ShiRo-25 Chinmay Rothe Masters Architecture (HBP) ARCH @ChinmayR5

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
• Install Eddy3D
  • Install BlueCFD in the default folder:
  • For versions <= 0.3.8.0, please install BlueCFD 2017 in the default folder:
    • C:\Program Files\blueCFD-Core-2017
  • For versions >= 0.4.0.10, please install BlueCFD 2020 in the default folder:
    • C:\Program Files\blueCFD-Core-2020
  • If you would like to use the experimental MRT component, please install Radiance in the default folder: C:\Program Files\Radiance

docs.title: Templates
docs.text:
• Eddy comes with starter templates that you can find by right clicking on the Template component, see below.
  • Select a template of your choice and follow the enumerated markers through the canvas.

docs.title: Parallel computation
docs.text: There is currently an issues with Microsoft’s and BlueCFD’s MPI dll which is why a run with multiple CPUs might fail. You need both dlls to be the same file, see here for instructions on how to ensure that.

docs.title: Simple workflows
docs.text: We value efficient workflows! See below for a one-directional urban CFD setup.

docs.title: ABL Condition
docs.text: Atmospheric Boundary Layer condition for air region

docs.title: WS
docs.text: Wind speed at the given Height

docs.title: H
docs.text: Heigh at which windspeed is given

docs.title: BD
docs.text: List of parameters of the box domain in the order: front,

docs.title: S
docs.text: Size of the cell in every direction of the box

docs.title: F
docs.text: Additional extension of box domain towards the front face, starting from the bounding box of all geometry.

docs.title: B
docs.text: Additional extension of box domain towards the back face, starting from the bounding box of all geometry.

docs.title: S
docs.text: Additional extension of box domain towards the side faces, starting from the bounding box of all geometry.

docs.title: T
docs.text: Additional extension of box domain towards the top face, starting from the bounding box of all geometry.

docs.title: R
docs.text: Additional extension of refinement box towards every face, starting from the bounding box of all geometry.

docs.title: B
docs.text: Box domain parameters as a list.

docs.title: BT
docs.text: Temperature inside the building in Celcius. This value stays constant for the entire simulation time

docs.title: C
docs.text: Case to run the simulation on

docs.title: PS
docs.text: Set to true to prepare the simulation

docs.title: PSp
docs.text: Set to true to prepare the simulation

docs.title: RS
docs.text: Set to true to run the simulation

docs.title: RSp
docs.text: Set to true to run the simulation in parallel

docs.title: L
docs.text: Names of the files that contain simulation logs

docs.title: L
docs.text: Content of the files that contain simulation logs

docs.title: Cell Zones
docs.text: Reads the cellZones.txt file to get cell zone names and their indices

docs.title: C
docs.text: UMCF Case class to extract the working directory

docs.title: I
docs.text: List of indices for each cell zone

docs.title: R
docs.text: Set to true to run the checkMesh command

docs.title: S
docs.text: Simulator instance with access to the case to check

docs.title: N
docs.text: Name of the region to check

docs.title: Logs
docs.text: Logs generated by the checkMesh command

docs.title: C
docs.text: Set to true to check if dependendies were installed correctly

docs.title: I
docs.text: Set to true to install urbanMicroclimateFoam

docs.title: CreateMesh
docs.text: Creates a mesh from point and face data in .txt files

docs.title: C
docs.text: UMCF Case class to extract the working directory

docs.title: I
docs.text: List of face indices to visualize (optional)

docs.title: MF
docs.text: Optional middle folders between region and file

docs.title: Create GH Plugin
docs.text: Creates a Grasshopper plugin in the input directory.

docs.title: W
docs.text: Set to true to write the GH plugin.

docs.title: P
docs.text: The directory of the MetaFOAM plugin.

docs.title: I
docs.text: Names of initial condition files to ignore.

docs.title: N
docs.text: If true, boundary conditions with no values are included in the Initial Condition inputs

docs.title: Z
docs.text: If true, inputs with value equal to 0 will be included in the initial condition inputs

docs.title: I
docs.text: Boundary conditions in this list will be ignored

docs.title: B
docs.text: Boundary condition that will be generated GH components for

docs.title: Create Setting
docs.text: Creates a custom Setting instance. Settings contain a list of entries.

docs.title: E
docs.text: Entries to be added to the Setting.

docs.title: Deconstruct Case
docs.text: Deconstructs a Case instance, exposing all types of file containers.

docs.title: I
docs.text: OpenFOAM initial condition dictionaries found in the directory, stored in file containers.

docs.title: D
docs.text: OpenFOAM dictionaries found in the directory, stored in file containers.

docs.title: L
docs.text: OpenFOAM lists found in the directory, stored in file containers.

docs.title: S
docs.text: Scripts found in the directory, stored in file containers.

docs.title: M
docs.text: Meshes found in the directory, stored in mesh containers.

docs.title: T
docs.text: Files that do not meet other categories.

docs.title: P
docs.text: Name of the patches found in the case initial conditions.

docs.title: C
docs.text: Conent of the entry as key value pairs.

docs.title: TR
docs.text: Total raw content of the file.

docs.title: I
docs.text: File container of type InitialCondition to deconstruct.

docs.title: P
docs.text: Name of patches addressed by initial condition

docs.title: Deconstruct Weather
docs.text: Deconstructs a Weather instance, exposing the weather information.

docs.title: Entry from a Key and Value
Entry from a Key and Value
A
docs.text: Address where the entry will modify or add content.

docs.title: Get Cells
docs.text: Group of mesh faces based on indices from owner and neighbour files

docs.title: C
docs.text: UMCF Case class to extract the working directory

docs.title: C
docs.text: List of cells containing a list of indices pointing to mesh faces

docs.title: P
docs.text: Name of the probing to get information from

docs.title: B
docs.text: Closed curve where grass will be added. This curve is projected to the terrain mesh to define the grass area

docs.title: Modify with Entry
docs.text: Modifies a file container with an entry.

docs.title: E
docs.text: Entries that will modify the file container.

docs.title: OpenFOAM Dictionary
docs.text: Creates an OpenFOAM dictioanry. Used as an input to modify OpenFOAM files

docs.title: K
docs.text: List of keys to store in the OF Dictionary.

docs.title: V
docs.text: List of values to store in the OF Dictionary.

docs.title: OpenFOAM List
docs.text: Creates an OpenFOAM list. Used as an input to modify OpenFOAM files

docs.title: V
docs.text: List of values to store in the OF Dictionary.

docs.title: Parse OF Headers
docs.text: Parses a directory looking for boundary conditions.

docs.title: S
docs.text: List of boundary conditions to select. If no list is provided, all boundary conditions are selected.

docs.title: PSF
docs.text: Boundary conditions of type FvPatchScalarField found, and that exist in the selection input.

docs.title: PVF
docs.text: Boundary conditions of type FvPatchVectorField found, and that exist in the selection input.

docs.title: PF
docs.text: Boundary conditions of type FvPatchFields found, and that exist in the selection input.

docs.title: PPF
docs.text: Boundary conditions of type PointPatchFields found, and that exist in the selection input.

docs.title: DF
docs.text: Boundary conditions of tpye DimensionedFields found, and that exist in the selection input.

docs.title: N
docs.text: Names of all boundary conditions found.

docs.title: R
docs.text: Set to true to run the probing

docs.title: I
docs.text: Probing interpolation scheme. 0 =  cell; 1 =  cellPoint; 2 = cellPointFace; 3 = pointMVC; 4 = cellPatchConstrained

docs.title: F
docs.text: Fields to probe. T = air temperature; Tl = Tl; U = wind velocity; alphat = turbulent thermal diffusivity; epsilon = turbulent dissipation rate; k = turbulent kinetic energy; nut = turbulent diffusivity; p = pressure; p_rgh = modified pressure without hydrostatic effects; rho = rho; rs = rs; w = humidity ratio

docs.title: C
docs.text: Probed case. Use GetProbes component to retrieve probe data

docs.title: Read OpenFOAM Case
docs.text: Reads an OpenFOAM case and outputs a Case instance with all its files.

docs.title: FCs
docs.text: File Containers found in the case.

docs.title: I
docs.text: Names of files in the directory that were not `added to the case

docs.title: IA
docs.text: Identify a feature when angle between faces < includedAngle

docs.title: CPUs
docs.text: Number of CPUs to be used

docs.title: ISTF
docs.text: urbanMicroclimateFoam controls: Initial Solid Timestep Factor

docs.title: minDT
docs.text: urbanMicroclimateFoam controls: Minimum time between iterations

docs.title: maxDT
docs.text: urbanMicroclimateFoam controls: Maximum time between iterations

docs.title: Simulator From Directory
docs.text: Creates a simulator instance from an existing case

docs.title: D
docs.text: Path to the directory to the existing case

docs.title: E
docs.text: Optional entries to modify the case

docs.title: I
docs.text: Names of additional files to include

docs.title: Solid Mesh Parameters
docs.text: Meshing parameters for solid for Solid Type component.

docs.title: FRL
docs.text: Feature refinement level. Default value is '4'

docs.title: LSRL
docs.text: Lower value of surface refinement level. Default value is '3'

docs.title: USRL
docs.text: Upper value of surface refinement level. Default value is '5'

docs.title: LRRL
docs.text: Lower value of region refinement level. Default value is '4'

docs.title: URRL
docs.text: Upper value of region refinement level. Default value is '3'

docs.title: LRRD
docs.text: Lower distance to which apply region refinement level. Default value is '1.0'

docs.title: URRD
docs.text: Upper distance to which apply region refinement level. Default value is '1.0'

docs.title: M
docs.text: Solid mesh paremeters for Solid Type component.

docs.title: SD
docs.text: Index of the day of the year to start the simulation on

docs.title: WC
docs.text: Set to true to write the case in the working directory

docs.title: CC
docs.text: Set to true to remove all files in the working directory

docs.title: CN
docs.text: Name of the new case to create. It cannot contain spaces

docs.title: WD
docs.text: Working directory to place the case files and results

docs.title: LSRL
docs.text: Lower value of surface refinement level. Default value is '3'

docs.title: USRL
docs.text: Upper value of surface refinement level. Default value is '5'

docs.title: LRRL
docs.text: Lower value of region refinement level. Default value is '5'

docs.title: URRL
docs.text: Upper value of region refinement level. Default value is '4'

docs.title: LRRD
docs.text: Lower distance to which apply region refinement level. Default value is '1.0'

docs.title: URRD
docs.text: Upper distance to which apply region refinement level. Default value is '2.0'

docs.title: Rg0
docs.text: global radiation at top of canopy

docs.title: Rl0
docs.text: long-wave radiation at top of canopy

docs.title: S
docs.text: Vegetation properties as a Setting instance.

docs.title: L
docs.text: Leaf Area Density of the vegetation

docs.title: Weather
docs.text: Reads an EPW file and creates a Weather instance for the simulation

docs.title: V
docs.text: The created calculated vector value instance.

docs.title: V
docs.text: The created uniform vector value instance
